info.description: Integrate your data with the Samsara API, customize the Samsara experience, and join a community of developers building with Samsara.
info.title: Samsara API

get.description: Returns a list of all addresses in an organization

parameters.description: The limit for how many objects will be in the response. Default and max for this value is 512 objects.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: If specified, this should be the endCursor value from the previous page of results. When present, this request will return the next page of results that occur immediately after the previous page of results.
parameters.name: after

parameters.description: A filter on the data based on this comma-separated list of tag IDs. Example: `tagIds=1234,5678`
parameters.name: tagIds

200.description: List of all addresses in the organization

post.description: Creates a new address in the organization

parameters.description: The address to create.
parameters.name: address

200.description: Newly created address object with ID.

parameters.description: The address fields to update.
parameters.name: address

parameters.description: ID of the Address. This can either be the Samsara-provided ID or an external ID. External IDs are customer-specified key-value pairs created in the POST or PATCH requests of this resource. To specify an external ID as part of a path parameter, use the following format: `key:value`. For example, `crmId:abc123`
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: If specified, this should be the endCursor value from the previous page of results. When present, this request will return the next page of results that occur immediately after the previous page of results.
parameters.name: after

post.description: Add a contact to the organization

parameters.description: The contact create parameters.
parameters.name: contact

parameters.description: Updates to the contact.
parameters.name: contact

200.description: Updated contact object with given ID.

parameters.description: Unique identifier for the contact.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: If value is true, only drivers that are deactivated will appear in the response. This parameter will default to false if not provided (fetching only active drivers).
parameters.name: isDeactivated

parameters.description: The limit for how many objects will be in the response. Default and max for this value is 512 objects.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: If specified, this should be the endCursor value from the previous page of results. When present, this request will return the next page of results that occur immediately after the previous page of results.
parameters.name: after

parameters.description: A filter on the data based on this comma-separated list of tag IDs. Example: `tagIds=1234,5678`
parameters.name: tagIds

parameters.description: A filter on data to have an updated at time after or equal to this specified time in RFC 3339 format. Millisecond precision and timezones are supported. (Examples: 2019-06-13T19:08:25Z, 2019-06-13T19:08:25.455Z, OR 2015-09-15T14:00:12-04:00).
parameters.name: updatedAfterTime

parameters.description: A filter on data to have a created at time after or equal to this specified time in RFC 3339 format. Millisecond precision and timezones are supported. (Examples: 2019-06-13T19:08:25Z, 2019-06-13T19:08:25.455Z, OR 2015-09-15T14:00:12-04:00).
parameters.name: createdAfterTime

post.description: Add a driver to the organization.

parameters.description: The driver to create.
parameters.name: driver

200.description: Newly created driver object, with Samsara-generated ID.

patch.description: Update a specific driver's information. This can also be used to activate or de-activate a given driver

parameters.description: Updates to the driver properties.
parameters.name: driver

parameters.description: ID of the driver. This can either be the Samsara-specified ID, or an external ID. External IDs are customer specified key-value pairs created in the POST or PATCH requests of this resource. To specify an external ID as part of a path parameter, use the following format: `key:value`. For example, `payrollId:ABFS18600`
parameters.name: id

get.description: Returns a list of all vehicles.

parameters.description: The limit for how many objects will be in the response. Default and max for this value is 512 objects.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: If specified, this should be the endCursor value from the previous page of results. When present, this request will return the next page of results that occur immediately after the previous page of results.
parameters.name: after

parameters.description: A filter on the data based on this comma-separated list of tag IDs. Example: `tagIds=1234,5678`
parameters.name: tagIds

200.description: List of all vehicle objects, and pagination parameters.

get.description: Returns last known location for all vehicles (connected via Samsara Vehicle Gateways). This can be optionally filtered by tags or specific vehicle IDs. See [here](https://developers.samsara.com/docs/vehicle-locations) for more details.

parameters.description: If specified, this should be the endCursor value from the previous page of results. When present, this request will return the next page of results that occur immediately after the previous page of results.
parameters.name: after

parameters.description: A filter on the data based on this comma-separated list of tag IDs. Example: `tagIds=1234,5678`
parameters.name: tagIds

parameters.description: A filter on the data based on this comma-separated list of vehicle IDs. Example: `vehicleIds=1234,5678`
parameters.name: vehicleIds

200.description: List of the most recent locations for the specified vehicles.

get.description:
Follow a continuous feed of all vehicle locations from Samsara Vehicle Gateways.

Your first call to this endpoint will provide you with the most recent location for each vehicle and a `pagination` object that contains an `endCursor`.

You can provide the `endCursor` to the `after` parameter of this endpoint to get location updates since that `endCursor`. 

If `hasNextPage` is `false`, no updates are readily available yet. We'd suggest waiting a minimum of 5 seconds before requesting updates.

See [this guide](https://developers.samsara.com/docs/vehicle-locations#section-follow-a-real-time-feed-of-vehicle-locations) for more details.
get.summary: Follow a feed of vehicle locations

parameters.description: If specified, this should be the endCursor value from the previous page of results. When present, this request will return the next page of results that occur immediately after the previous page of results.
parameters.name: after

parameters.description: A filter on the data based on this comma-separated list of tag IDs. Example: `tagIds=1234,5678`
parameters.name: tagIds

parameters.description: A filter on the data based on this comma-separated list of vehicle IDs. Example: `vehicleIds=1234,5678`
parameters.name: vehicleIds

200.description: List of locations events for the specified vehicles.

get.description: Returns all known vehicle locations during the given time range for all vehicles (connected via Samsara Vehicle Gateways). This can be optionally filtered by tags or specific vehicle IDs. See [here](https://developers.samsara.com/docs/vehicle-locations) for more details.

parameters.description: If specified, this should be the endCursor value from the previous page of results. When present, this request will return the next page of results that occur immediately after the previous page of results.
parameters.name: after

parameters.description: A start time in RFC 3339 format. Millisecond precision and timezones are supported. (Examples: 2019-06-13T19:08:25Z, 2019-06-13T19:08:25.455Z, OR 2015-09-15T14:00:12-04:00).
parameters.name: startTime

parameters.description: An end time in RFC 3339 format. Millisecond precision and timezones are supported. (Examples: 2019-06-13T19:08:25Z, 2019-06-13T19:08:25.455Z, OR 2015-09-15T14:00:12-04:00).
parameters.name: endTime

parameters.description: A filter on the data based on this comma-separated list of tag IDs. Example: `tagIds=1234,5678`
parameters.name: tagIds

parameters.description: A filter on the data based on this comma-separated list of vehicle IDs. Example: `vehicleIds=1234,5678`
parameters.name: vehicleIds

200.description: List of all locations for the specified vehicles and time range.

get.description: Returns last known stats for all vehicles (connected via Samsara Vehicle Gateways). This can be optionally filtered by tags or specific vehicle IDs. See [here](https://developers.samsara.com/docs/vehicle-stats) for more details.

parameters.description: If specified, this should be the endCursor value from the previous page of results. When present, this request will return the next page of results that occur immediately after the previous page of results.
parameters.name: after

parameters.description: A filter on the data based on this comma-separated list of tag IDs. Example: `tagIds=1234,5678`
parameters.name: tagIds

parameters.description: A filter on the data based on this comma-separated list of vehicle IDs. Example: `vehicleIds=1234,5678`
parameters.name: vehicleIds

parameters.description:
The stat type you want this endpoint to return information on. Currently only one stat type is accepted per request.

- `engineStates`: The state of the engine (`Off`, `On`, `Idle`).
- `fuelPercents`: The engine fuel level in percentage points (e.g. `99`, `50`, etc).
- `obdOdometerMeters`: The odometer reading according to on-board diagnostics. If Samsara does not have diagnostic coverage for a particular vehicle, the value for this stat type will be omitted. In these cases, we recommend using `gpsOdometerMeters`.
- `gpsOdometerMeters`: The odometer reading according to GPS calculations. This calculation is based off GPS distance traveled and a manual odometer offset for a given vehicle, specified by the user in Samsara's dashboard UI or through the `odometerMeters` field in the [PATCH /fleet/vehicles/{id}](#operation/updateVehicleById) endpoint. `gpsOdometerMeters` is equal to the manual offset plus the GPS distance traveled since the offset was set. The value for this stat type will be omitted if a manual offset is not provided for a given vehicle. *A manual offset can only be provided when we do not have diagnostic coverage for a particular vehicle.*
- `obdEngineSeconds`: The cumulative number of seconds the engine has run according to on-board diagnostics.
- `gpsDistanceMeters`: The distance the vehicle has traveled since the gateway was installed based on GPS calculations.
parameters.name: types

200.description: List of the most recent stats for the specified vehicles and stat types.

get.description:
Follow a continuous feed of vehicle stats from Samsara Vehicle Gateways.

Your first call to this endpoint will provide you with the most recent stats for each vehicle and a `pagination` object that contains an `endCursor`.

You can provide the `endCursor` to the `after` parameter of this endpoint to get vehicle stat updates since that `endCursor`.

If `hasNextPage` is `false`, no updates are readily available yet. Each stat type has a different refresh rate, but in general we'd suggest waiting a minimum of 5 seconds before requesting updates. See [this guide](https://developers.samsara.com/docs/vehicle-stats#section-follow-a-real-time-feed-of-vehicle-stats) for more details.
get.summary: Follow a feed of vehicle stats

parameters.description: If specified, this should be the endCursor value from the previous page of results. When present, this request will return the next page of results that occur immediately after the previous page of results.
parameters.name: after

parameters.description: A filter on the data based on this comma-separated list of tag IDs. Example: `tagIds=1234,5678`
parameters.name: tagIds

parameters.description: A filter on the data based on this comma-separated list of vehicle IDs. Example: `vehicleIds=1234,5678`
parameters.name: vehicleIds

parameters.description:
The stat type you want this endpoint to return information on. Currently only one stat type is accepted per request.

- `engineStates`: The state of the engine (`Off`, `On`, `Idle`).
- `fuelPercents`: The engine fuel level in percentage points (e.g. `99`, `50`, etc).
- `obdOdometerMeters`: The odometer reading according to on-board diagnostics. If Samsara does not have diagnostic coverage for a particular vehicle, the value for this stat type will be omitted. In these cases, we recommend using `gpsOdometerMeters`.
- `gpsOdometerMeters`: The odometer reading according to GPS calculations. This calculation is based off GPS distance traveled and a manual odometer offset for a given vehicle, specified by the user in Samsara's dashboard UI or through the `odometerMeters` field in the [PATCH /fleet/vehicles/{id}](#operation/updateVehicleById) endpoint. `gpsOdometerMeters` is equal to the manual offset plus the GPS distance traveled since the offset was set. The value for this stat type will be omitted if a manual offset is not provided for a given vehicle. *A manual offset can only be provided when we do not have diagnostic coverage for a particular vehicle.*
- `obdEngineSeconds`: The cumulative number of seconds the engine has run according to on-board diagnostics.
- `gpsDistanceMeters`: The distance the vehicle has traveled since the gateway was installed based on GPS calculations.
parameters.name: types

200.description: List of stat events for the specified vehicles and stat types.

get.description: Returns vehicle stats events during the given time range for all vehicles (connected via Samsara Vehicle Gateways). This can be optionally filtered by tags or specific vehicle IDs. See [here](https://developers.samsara.com/docs/vehicle-stats) for more details.

parameters.description: If specified, this should be the endCursor value from the previous page of results. When present, this request will return the next page of results that occur immediately after the previous page of results.
parameters.name: after

parameters.description: A start time in RFC 3339 format. Millisecond precision and timezones are supported. (Examples: 2019-06-13T19:08:25Z, 2019-06-13T19:08:25.455Z, OR 2015-09-15T14:00:12-04:00).
parameters.name: startTime

parameters.description: An end time in RFC 3339 format. Millisecond precision and timezones are supported. (Examples: 2019-06-13T19:08:25Z, 2019-06-13T19:08:25.455Z, OR 2015-09-15T14:00:12-04:00).
parameters.name: endTime

parameters.description: A filter on the data based on this comma-separated list of tag IDs. Example: `tagIds=1234,5678`
parameters.name: tagIds

parameters.description: A filter on the data based on this comma-separated list of vehicle IDs. Example: `vehicleIds=1234,5678`
parameters.name: vehicleIds

parameters.description:
The stat type you want this endpoint to return information on. Currently only one stat type is accepted per request.

- `engineStates`: The state of the engine (`Off`, `On`, `Idle`).
- `fuelPercents`: The engine fuel level in percentage points (e.g. `99`, `50`, etc).
- `obdOdometerMeters`: The odometer reading according to on-board diagnostics. If Samsara does not have diagnostic coverage for a particular vehicle, the value for this stat type will be omitted. In these cases, we recommend using `gpsOdometerMeters`.
- `gpsOdometerMeters`: The odometer reading according to GPS calculations. This calculation is based off GPS distance traveled and a manual odometer offset for a given vehicle, specified by the user in Samsara's dashboard UI or through the `odometerMeters` field in the [PATCH /fleet/vehicles/{id}](#operation/updateVehicleById) endpoint. `gpsOdometerMeters` is equal to the manual offset plus the GPS distance traveled since the offset was set. The value for this stat type will be omitted if a manual offset is not provided for a given vehicle. *A manual offset can only be provided when we do not have diagnostic coverage for a particular vehicle.*
- `obdEngineSeconds`: The cumulative number of seconds the engine has run according to on-board diagnostics.
- `gpsDistanceMeters`: The distance the vehicle has traveled since the gateway was installed based on GPS calculations.
parameters.name: types

200.description: List of vehicle stats for the specified vehicles, stat type, and time range.

get.description: Get information about a specific vehicle.

patch.description:
Updates the given Vehicle object.

**Note:** Vehicle objects are automatically created when Samsara Vehicle Gateways are installed. You cannot create a Vehicle object via API.

You are able to *update* many of the fields of a Vehicle.

**Note**: There are no required fields in the request body, and you only need to provide the fields you wish to update.

parameters.description: Fields that can be patched on a vehicle.
parameters.name: vehicle

parameters.description: ID of the vehicle. This can either be the Samsara-specified ID, or an external ID. External IDs are customer specified key-value pairs created in the POST or PATCH requests of this resource. To specify an external ID as part of a path parameter, use the following format: `key:value`. For example, `maintenanceId:250020`
parameters.name: id

get.description: Return all of the tags for an organization.

parameters.description: The limit for how many objects will be in the response. Default and max for this value is 512 objects.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: If specified, this should be the endCursor value from the previous page of results. When present, this request will return the next page of results that occur immediately after the previous page of results.
parameters.name: after

post.description: Create a new tag for the organization.

200.description: Newly created tag object, including the new tag ID.
The tag corresponding to request id.

put.description: Update a tag with a new name and new members. This API call would replace all old members of a tag with new members specified in the request body.

204.description: Successfully deleted the tag. No response body is returned.

parameters.description: Unique identifier for the tag.
parameters.name: id

parameters.name: id

AddressContactIds.description: An array of Contact IDs associated with this Address.

AddressContacts.description: An array Contact mini-objects that are associated the Address.

AddressFormattedAddress.description: The full street address for this address/geofence, as it might be recognized by Google Maps.
AddressFormattedAddress.example: 350 Rhode Island St, San Francisco, CA

AddressGeofence.description: The geofence that defines this address and its bounds. This can either be a circle or a polygon, but not both.

circle.description: Information about a circular geofence. This field is only needed if the geofence is a circle.

radiusMeters.description: The radius of the circular geofence in meters.

polygon.description: Information about a polygon geofence. This field is only needed if the geofence is a polygon.

vertices.description: The vertices of the polygon geofence. These geofence vertices describe the perimeter of the polygon, and must consist of at least 3 vertices and less than 40.

latitude.description: The latitude of a geofence vertex in decimal degrees.

longitude.description: The longitude of a geofence vertex in decimal degrees.

AddressLatitude.description: Latitude of the address. Will be geocoded from `formattedAddress` if not provided.

AddressLongitude.description: Longitude of the address. Will be geocoded from `formattedAddress` if not provided.

AddressNotes.example: Hours of operation: 8am - 6pm; Truck entrance on the Rhode Island street side.

AddressTagIds.description: An array of IDs of tags to associate with this address.

AddressTags.description: An array of all tag mini-objects that are associated with the given address entry.

AddressTypes.description: Reporting location type associated with the address (used for ELD reporting purposes).

Contact.description: Information about a notification contact for alerts.

CreateAddressRequest.description: A request body to create an Address.

CreateContactRequest.description: Information for adding a notification contact for alerts.

addresses.description: The addresses that belong to this tag.

assets.description: The trailers, unpowered, and powered assets that belong to this tag.

drivers.description: The drivers that belong to this tag.

machines.description: The machines that belong to this tag.

sensors.description: The sensors that belong to this tag.

vehicles.description: The vehicles that belong to this tag.

DriverCarrierSettings.description: Carrier for a given driver. If the driver's carrier differs from the general organization's carrier settings, the override value is used. Updating this value only updates the override setting for this driver.

DriverCreatedAtTime.description: The date and time this driver was created in RFC 3339 format.

DriverDotNumber.description: Carrier US DOT Number. If this differs from the general organization's settings, the override value is used. Updating this value only updates the override setting for this driver.

DriverEldAdverseWeatherExemptionEnabled.description: Flag indicating this driver may use Adverse Weather exemptions in ELD logs.

DriverEldBigDayExemptionEnabled.description: Flag indicating this driver may use Big Day exemption in ELD logs.

DriverEldDayStartHour.description: `0` indicating midnight-to-midnight ELD driving hours, `12` to indicate noon-to-noon driving hours.

DriverEldExempt.description: Flag indicating this driver is exempt from the Electronic Logging Mandate.

DriverEldExemptReason.description: Reason that this driver is exempt from the Electronic Logging Mandate (see eldExempt).

DriverEldPcEnabled.description: Flag indicating this driver may select the Personal Conveyance duty status in ELD logs.

DriverEldYmEnabled.description: Flag indicating this driver may select the Yard Move duty status in ELD logs.

DriverIsDeactivated.description: A boolean indicating whether or not the driver is deactivated.

DriverLicenseNumber.description: Driver's state issued license number. The combination of this number and `licenseState` must be unique.

DriverLicenseState.description: Abbreviation of state that issued driver's license.

DriverLocale.description: Locale override (uncommon). These are specified by ISO 3166-2 country codes for supported locales.

DriverMainOfficeAddress.description: Main office address for a given driver. If this differs from the general organization's settings, the override value is used.

DriverNotes.example: Also goes by the nickname Furious Fred.

DriverPassword.description: Password that the driver can use to login to the Samsara driver app.

allOf.description: Vehicle assigned to the driver for static vehicle assignments. (uncommon).

DriverStaticAssignedVehicleId.description: ID of vehicle that the driver is permanently assigned to. (uncommon).

DriverTachographCardNumber.description: Driver's assigned tachograph card number (Europe specific)

DriverTagIds.description: IDs of tags the driver is associated with.

DriverTags.description: The tags this driver belongs to.

DriverTimezone.description: Home terminal timezone, in order to indicate what time zone should be used to calculate the ELD logs. Driver timezones use [IANA timezone database](https://www.iana.org/time-zones) keys (e.g. `America/Los_Angeles`, `America/New_York`, `Europe/London`, etc.). You can find a mapping of common timezone formats to IANA timezone keys [here](https://unicode.org/cldr/charts/latest/supplemental/zone_tzid.html).

DriverUpdatedAtTime.description: The date and time this driver was last updated in RFC 3339 format.

DriverUsername.description: Driver's login username into the driver app. The username may not contain spaces or the '@' symbol. The username must be unique.

allOf.description: Tag which determines which vehicles a driver will see when selecting vehicles.

DriverVehicleGroupTagId.description: Tag ID which determines which vehicles a driver will see when selecting vehicles.

ListAddressesResponse.description: A list of Addresses and pagination information.

ListVehiclesResponse.description: Response for retrieving a list of vehicles.

ParentTag.description: If this tag is part a hierarchical tag tree, this is the parent tag, otherwise this will be omitted.

ParentTagId.description: If this tag is part a hierarchical tag tree, this is the ID of the parent tag, otherwise this will be omitted.

addresses.description: The addresses that belong to this tag.

assets.description: The trailers, unpowered, and powered assets that belong to this tag.

drivers.description: The drivers that belong to this tag.

machines.description: The machines that belong to this tag.

sensors.description: The sensors that belong to this tag.

vehicles.description: The vehicles that belong to this tag.

addresses.description: The addresses that belong to this tag.

assets.description: The trailers, unpowered, and powered assets that belong to this tag.

drivers.description: The drivers that belong to this tag.

machines.description: The machines that belong to thistag.

sensors.description: The sensors that belong to this tag.

vehicles.description: The vehicles that belong to this tag.

TagId.description: Unique Samsara ID of this tag.

UpdateAddressRequest.description: A request body to update an Address.

UpdateContactRequest.description: Information for adding a notification contact for alerts.

UpdateVehicleRequest.description: All the editable portions of the vehicle object.

UserAuthType.description: The authentication type the user uses to authenticate. To use SAML this organization must have a configured SAML integration.

UserEmail.description: The email address of this user.

UserName.description: The first and last name of the user.

allOf.description: The id of the tag used to grant a role. If no tag is specified, this role applies at the organization level.

roleId.description: The id of the role the user has been granted.

tagId.description: The id of the tag used to grant a role. If no tag is specified, this role applies at the organization level.

UserTagRolesRequest.description: The roles for this user. Users must have at least a single role to be a part of an organization.

VehicleAuxInputType.description: The type of [auxiliary input](https://kb.samsara.com/hc/en-us/articles/232232368-Auxiliary-Inputs) configured for this Vehicle. Once configured, these inputs will generate dynamic, time-series data that will be available to view in the Samsara Dashboard. **By default**: empty. This can be set or updated through the Samsara Dashboard or the API at any time.

VehicleEngineHours.description: A manual override for the vehicle's engine hours. You may only override a vehicle's engine hours if it cannot be read from on-board diagnostics. When you provide a manual engine hours override, Samsara will begin updating a vehicle's engine hours based on when the Samsara Vehicle Gateway is recieving power or not.

VehicleHarshAccelerationSettingType.description: The harsh acceleration setting type. This setting influences the acceleration sensitivity from which a [harsh event](https://kb.samsara.com/hc/en-us/articles/360006938891-Harsh-Events) is triggered. **By default**, this setting is inferred by the Samsara Vehicle Gateway from the engine computer, but it may be set or updated through the Samsara Dashboard or the API at any time. If set to `off`, then no acceleration based harsh events are triggered for the vehicle.

VehicleId.description: The unique Samsara ID of the Vehicle. This is automatically generated when the Vehicle object is created. It cannot be changed.

VehicleLicensePlate.description: The license plate of the Vehicle. **By default**: empty. Can be set or updated through the Samsara Dashboard or the API at any time.

VehicleLocationHeading.description: Heading of the vehicle in degrees.

formattedLocation.description: Formatted address of the reverse geocoding data.
formattedLocation.example: 16 N Fair Oaks Ave, Pasadena, CA 91103

VehicleLocationSpeed.description: GPS speed of the vehicle in miles per hour.

VehicleLocationsListResponse.description: List of vehicle location events and pagination info.

data.description: A list of vehicles and an array of location events for each vehicle.

items.description: A vehicle and its list of location events.

locations.description: A list of location events for the given vehicle.

VehicleLocationsResponse.description: Most recent vehicle locations and pagination info.

data.description: List of the most recent locations for the specified vehicles.

items.description: A vehicle and its most recent location.

VehicleMake.description: The Vehicle’s manufacturing make. Automatically read from the engine computer if available. Empty if not available. Cannot be manually set.

VehicleModel.description: The Vehicle’s manufacturing model. Automatically read from the engine computer if available. Empty if not available. Cannot be manually set.

VehicleName.description: The human-readable name of the Vehicle. This is set by a fleet administrator and will appear in both Samsara’s cloud dashboard as well as the Samsara Driver mobile app. **By default**, this name is the serial number of the Samsara Vehicle Gateway. It can be set or updated through the Samsara Dashboard or through the API at any time.

VehicleNotes.description: These are generic notes about the Vehicle. Empty by default. Can be set or updated through the Samsara Dashboard or the API at any time.
VehicleNotes.example: These are notes about this given vehicle.

VehicleOdometerMeters.description: A manual override for the vehicle's odometer. You may only override a vehicle's odometer if it cannot be read from on-board diagnostics. When you provide a manual odometer override, Samsara will begin updating a vehicle's odometer using GPS distance traveled since this override was set. See [here](https://kb.samsara.com/hc/en-us/articles/115005273667) for more details.

VehicleStaticAssignedDriverId.description: ID for the static assigned driver of the vehicle.

value.description: The engine fuel level in percentage points (e.g. `99`, `50`, etc).
Number of meters the vehicle has traveled since the gateway was installed, based on GPS calculations.
Number of meters the vehicle has traveled according to the GPS calculations and the manually-specified odometer reading.

VehicleStatsListResponse.description: List of vehicle stat events and pagination info.

data.description: A list of vehicles and an array of stat events for each vehicle.

items.description: A vehicle and its list of stat events.

engineStates.description: A list of engine state events for the given vehicle.

fuelPercents.description: A list of fuel percentage readings for the given vehicle.

gpsDistanceMeters.description: A list of GPS distance events for the given vehicle.

gpsOdometerMeters.description: A list of GPS odometer events for the given vehicle.

obdEngineSeconds.description: A list of OBD engine seconds readings for the given vehicle.

obdOdometerMeters.description: A list of OBD odometer readings for the given vehicle.

value.description: Number of seconds the vehicle's engine has been on according to the on-baord diagnostics.
Number of meters the vehicle has traveled according to the on-board diagnostics.

VehicleStatsResponse.description: Most recent vehicle stats and pagination info.

data.description: List of the most recent stats for the specified vehicles and stat types.

items.description: A vehicle and its most recent stat.

VehicleTagIds.description: An array of IDs of tags to associate with this vehicle.

VehicleTags.description: The list of [tags](https://kb.samsara.com/hc/en-us/articles/360026674631-Using-Tags-and-Tag-Nesting) associated with the Vehicle. **By default**: empty. Can be set or updated through the Samsara Dashboard or the API at any time.

VehicleVin.description: The VIN of the Vehicle. Most of the time, this will be automatically read from the engine computer by the Samsara Vehicle Gateway. It will be empty if it cannot be read. It can be set or updated through the Samsara Dashboard or the API at any time.

VehicleYear.description: The Vehicle’s manufacturing model. Automatically read from the engine computer if available. Empty if not available. Cannot be manually set.

endCursor.description: Cursor identifier representing the last element in the response. This value should be used in conjunction with a subsequent request's 'after' query parameter. This may be an empty string if there are no more pages left to view.

hasNextPage.description: True if there are more pages of results immediately available after this endCursor.

parentTagId.description: If this tag is part a hierarchical tag tree, this is the ID of the parent tag, otherwise this will be omitted.

time.description: UTC timestamp in RFC 3339 format. Example: `2020-01-27T07:06:25Z`.

id.description: The unique ID for the role.

isDeactivatedParam.description: If value is true, only drivers that are deactivated will appear in the response. This parameter will default to false if not provided (fetching only active drivers).
isDeactivatedParam.name: isDeactivated

vehicleStatTypes.description:
The stat type you want this endpoint to return information on. Currently only one stat type is accepted per request.

- `engineStates`: The state of the engine (`Off`, `On`, `Idle`).
- `fuelPercents`: The engine fuel level in percentage points (e.g. `99`, `50`, etc).
- `obdOdometerMeters`: The odometer reading according to on-board diagnostics. If Samsara does not have diagnostic coverage for a particular vehicle, the value for this stat type will be omitted. In these cases, we recommend using `gpsOdometerMeters`.
- `gpsOdometerMeters`: The odometer reading according to GPS calculations. This calculation is based off GPS distance traveled and a manual odometer offset for a given vehicle, specified by the user in Samsara's dashboard UI or through the `odometerMeters` field in the [PATCH /fleet/vehicles/{id}](#operation/updateVehicleById) endpoint. `gpsOdometerMeters` is equal to the manual offset plus the GPS distance traveled since the offset was set. The value for this stat type will be omitted if a manual offset is not provided for a given vehicle. *A manual offset can only be provided when we do not have diagnostic coverage for a particular vehicle.*
- `obdEngineSeconds`: The cumulative number of seconds the engine has run according to on-board diagnostics.
- `gpsDistanceMeters`: The distance the vehicle has traveled since the gateway was installed based on GPS calculations.
vehicleStatTypes.name: types
